benchmark_details.name: Deep Research Bench
benchmark_details.overview: Deep Research Bench is a benchmark designed to evaluate LLM agents on complex web research tasks reflecting real-world problems faced by analysts in various industries. It provides a controlled testing environment with a large frozen set of scraped web pages, enabling reliable evaluations over time.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate the capabilities of large language models (LLMs) on real-world web research tasks through a benchmark framework.

data.source: Constructed from web research tasks reflecting real-world use cases.
data.annotation: Answers carefully verified by skilled humans.

methodology.calculation: Scores are calculated based on specific criteria for each task type, including success criteria and consistency with ground truth.
methodology.interpretation: Scores reflect how well models perform on tasks against established criteria based on human assessments and automated evaluations.
methodology.validation: Continuous updates and evaluations as new models are released.
